review_title: Really happy this is in vr
one_reviews_text: I played this game since i was 7 on mobile and now oculus and im still having lots of fun with the game.

you want Gandalf?

Download the BombSquad PC version (www.files.froemling.net/bombsquad/builds/BombSquad_Windows_1.4.145.zip ) and install.
Merge accounts with the oculus and PC. 
Buy Grumbledorf on PC version. 
Copy the folders (BombSquad/data/ only audio, models, textures) and replace in VR version (C:\Program Files\Oculus\Software\Software\eric-froemling-bombsquad-vr\BombSquad_Windows_Oculus\data)
Enjoy playing with Gendalf in VR.

Sorry for bad English.

P.S. I advise you to make a copy of the VR game version before work.
Great game, plus could have a rank mode to increase the game's competitiveness.
The funniest game ever. Somebody knows a similar game?
But it will not install... I got it to start, then it went right back.... And now I cant click the install.. its there it clicks but does nothing lol

I was initially disappointed by this as it appeared to be a 2D game adapted for VR, but I soon forgot about that 'cause I was too busy laughing. It loads quickly, is great for killing a few minutes, and I play it almost every time I use my Rift.
So much entertainment for so little HDD space. :)

review_title: Amazing replay value, full of players!
one_reviews_text: Being cross-platform, the game is chokeful of players. It is some variant of bomberman, with capture the flag and other modes thrown in. The slightly janky physics play in the fun atmosphere. I played this game way more than I would like to admit and still come back to it a few times a week! Only drawback, no touch as a joypad support. I have emailed the developper about this.
Bomberman meets super smash bros brawl meets gangbeasts...FUN!

review_title: One of the MOST fun games
one_reviews_text: It's cheap, is multiplayer (crossplatform) and makes a lot of fun. The physics of this game are SUPER SUPER fun and I still have to lose the fun of this game.. I wish more people would play this.. since the release on Oculus Home the dev did a lot of improvements to the game like a queue for rooms and so on!

This is such a hugely underrated game. It's similar to that classic "bomb your opponents" game except friendly fire is always on and the characters are, well.. clumsy. Flags can be grabbed by multiple people which frequently causes hilarious games of tug-o-war. 

I got this with some of my Oculus store credit and to be honest I might not have tried it otherwise. Now that I've played it though, it's definitely worth picking up. I've played it WAY more than Valkyrie and that game is $60.
I have played this game a ton. You might see me around.. I am the reaper.. add me, I need some rift friends! tvanderpool9
The game screen is very good, very interesting,
